title: No need for concern over COVID cases, says CM
content: State has 727 active cases and govt. has put in place requisite testing and trearment facilities, says Pinarayi

title: Delimitation: 129 new wards in grama panchayats in Ernakulam
content: A total of 1,990 wards have been formed in the district across 82 grama panchayats, 13 municipalities, and the Kochi Corporation. Of them, 147 are new wards

title: Pakistan has nothing positive to offer; it is a cradle for terror says PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that Pakistan should understand that we have entered their house and hit them three times

title: West Bengal‚Äôs role is critical to vision of a developed India, says PM
content: The PM said the City Gas Distribution network was an example of doorstep delivery  of schemes; clean and affordable energy will be supplied to households via a pipeline

title: Aspirational Nuh, abandoned education
content: Haryana‚Äôs Nuh district ranks the lowest in the State board examination results, which were released earlier in May. With a 45% dropout rate after Class 10, officials blame cheating, teachers cite staff shortage, and parents question the value of education amid poor employment opportunities in the State, Samridhi Tewari reports

title: BSF fortifies village guards initiative with arms training for Jammu border residents
content: In one of the largest deployments in recent times, more than 52,000 Central forces to be posted for Amarnath Yatra security; this is likely the first time the BSF has been engaged to provide training to village defence guards; earlier provided with .303 rifles, the guards are being provided with semi-automatic guns

title: The case for a special fiscal package for Andhra Pradesh
content: It is for the Finance Commission to come up with an apolitical and formula-based solution so that States that have lost fiscal capacity are not abandoned

title: ED official arrested for accepting ‚Çπ20 lakh bribe in Bhubaneswar
content: The Deputy Director-level officer had reportedly struck a ‚Çπ50 lakh deal with a Bhubaneswar-based mine operator

title: A hype comes crashing down
content: The collapse of the newly built National Highway 66 at Malappuram and the deep fissures that were developed on the road stretches in Thrissur, Kozhikode and Kannur districts have caught the State and the Union governments off guard. As questions are being raised about public safety and the technical feasibility of the ambitious road projects in the State, Abdul Latheef Naha hits the road to weigh up the situation

title: Courts cannot remain mute spectators, Karnataka HC says in order to ban Proton Mail over digital sexual abuse
content: One month after pronouncing order, HC releases full judgement; Swiss-based encrypted mail platform still accessible in India; Proton had refused to help lawyers identify users who sent obscene emails to a woman

title: 4 kgs ganja seized, seven peddlers arrested
content: With ongoing investigations, more arrests are likely to take place, says Krishna district Superintendent of Police R. Gangadhar Rao

title: New rail lines in M.P. will boost freight movement and tourism, says Railways Minister
content: ‚Çπ1,018 crore project to ease congestion on high-density route; new trains and station upgrades announced for Madhya Pradesh

title: Election Commission‚Äôs one-point dashboard to become operational before Bihar election
content: Named ‚ÄòECINET‚Äô, it is aimed at providing all services for stakeholders at a single point, instead of the over 40 apps or websites that exist now

title: Heavy rain continues to pound Ernakulam
content: Three houses fully damaged‚Äî one each in Kanayannur, Kochi and Kothamangalam taluks; waterlogging hits usual trouble spots within Corporation limits; bylanes in Thoppumpady, Palluruthy, Kannamaly, and Edakochi reported flooding

title: Amit Shah arrives in J&K to review security situation, plans for Amarnath Yatra
content: Union Home Minister will meet border residents affected by Pakistan shelling; parties hopeful of financial package

title: Murmu inaugurates two-day literary conference
content: The conference will deliberate on topics such as ‚ÄòFeminist Literature of India: Breaking New Grounds‚Äô; ‚ÄòChange in Literature vs Literature of Change‚Äô; and ‚ÄòNew Directions of Indian Literature in Global Perspective‚Äô

title: MiTran Global to hold two-day online camp for teenagers to impart positivity
content: Final summer edition designed to equip young minds with focused learning strategies through modules on memory techniques and growth mindset; workbook and certificate included.

title: Tamil Nadu government constitutes Seventh State Finance Commission
content: It will review the financial position of various urban and rural local bodies and make appropriate recommendations on the distribution of funds to be provided by the State government

title: Bengal‚Äôs protesting teachers ‚Äòignored by PM and CM‚Äô as one dies of ‚Äòstress‚Äô
content: One of the teachers died of a stroke allegedly caused by stress; he was suffering from an underlying ailment¬†

title: Bangladesh should focus on solving its governance issues: India
content: ‚ÄúAs far as the government there is concerned, the responsibility for law and order and governance issues lies entirely with that government,‚Äù Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said.

title: Lok Sabha Speaker to lead delegation to BRICS inter-parliamentary forum
content: Speaker Om Birla may also hold bilateral meetings with the Presiding Officers of the participating Parliaments on the sidelines of the forum, the Lok Sabha Secretariat said

title: Amid unrest, truck driver abducted in Manipur
content: The State‚Äôs Chief Secretary, P.K. Singh, said the government will ensure that the May 20 bus incident is not repeated

title: No talks till Pakistan renounces terror, vacates PoK: India
content: Any India-Pakistan engagement must be bilateral, says Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal, adding that talks on trade, the Indus Waters treaty, or J&K cannot be held while Pakistan promotes terror and occupies Indian territory

title: Criminal charges against Ashoka University professor are ‚Äòoutrageous and absurd‚Äô, say a group of former civil servants
content: The Constitutional Conduct Group‚Äôs statement said the perils and consequences of suppressing free speech by the unjust application of criminal law could be profoundly corrosive for a society

title: Centre‚Äôs MSP does not cover input costs, claims Congress¬†
content: Referring to the MSP on paddy announced by the Centre, the Congress leader claimed that it was ‚Çπ766 lower than the C2 plus 50% formula

title: Nari Shakti played crucial role during Operation Sindoor: Rajnath Singh
content: Mr. Singh said ever since the participation of women in the armed forces increased, they had performed exceptionally well in every role and fulfilled every responsibility

title: Give generous relief package to residents of Poonch: Rahul Gandhi
content: ‚ÄúHundreds of homes, shops, schools and religious places have been badly damaged. Many victims said years of hard work has been destroyed in one stroke,‚Äù wrote the Congress leader

title: Bangalore Palace grounds: Supreme Court suspends use/transfer of TDRs
content: SC halts release of ‚Çπ3,000 crore TDRs to Mysuru royal heirs; questions over compensation and acquisition law raised

title: Maharashtra farmers write to CM, Deputy CMs seeking relief for rain-damaged onion crop
content: The farmers said the onion-producing districts in the State had been facing untimely rains since May 6, which had financially broken the spirit of the affected farmers, already reeling under debt

title: No need for apprehension on final confirmation of Plus One applications: Minister
content: First allotment in the main phase of allotment will be published at 5 p.m. on June 2, says Sivankutty

title: Air Chief Marshal flags delays in defence projects, invites private players to contribute
content: While hailing Operation Sindoor as a national victory, Air Chief stressed the need for self-reliance, indigenous design, and enhanced research and development to be ‚Äònow-ready for future conflicts‚Äô.

title: India hopes U.S. will clear visas on merit
content: Ministry of External Affairs declines to confirm whether issues such as the student visa pause or Trump administration claims on brokering the India-Pakistan ceasefire were raised during Foreign Secretary‚Äôs meetings in Washington

title: Telephone tapping accused Prabhakar Rao gets arrest protection order from Supreme Court, to return to India
content: The bench directed that the passport/travel document ‚Äòonly to travel to India‚Äô should be made available to the retired police officer

title: Tourism sector in jitters ahead of peak monsoon
content: Government should identify hotspots prone to landslips and issue guidelines for travellers well ahead of monsoon season. Closing down the hotspots during the peak of the monsoon and publicising other safe destinations and holding special campaigns will help instil confidence among  tourists and save the prospects of the sector, says a stakeholder

title: Rain, gusty wind inflict heavy damage on Kerala
content: Youth dies after tree falls on a parked car in Kumily; several areas in Kuttanad inundated prompting emergency evacuations; IMD issues red alert for Idukki, Kannur, and Kasaragod districts

title: BRS questions rationale behind escalating cost of Young India schools from ‚Çπ80-‚Çπ200 crore
content: Party leaders Sabitha Indra Reddy, Vanidevi want to know the fate of existing schools once the proposed schools are set up

title: Kerala govt. bans fishing within 20-nautical mile radius of shipwreck, announces compensation for fishers
content: 6 kg of free rice and ‚Çπ1,000 a month to each affected fisher families in Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Alappuzha and Ernakulam districts. Chief Minister dismisses speculation that fish caught off the coast of Kerala was inedible

title: IMD issues alert as deep depression crosses West Bengal coast
content: Cyclonic system enters through Sagar Island-Raidighi corridor; fisherfolk warned, CM assures preparedness amid forecasts of heavy rainfall

title: Chief Minister puts Kerala in emergency disaster preparedness mode as monsoon intensifies
content: Government has requisitioned the Centre for at least nine National Disaster Response Force teams until the monsoon abates. The teams will be deployed in Idukki, Malappuram, Kasaragod, and Thrissur¬†

title: The Congress, and AAP ‚Äòbetrayed Sikhs for decades‚Äô, says BJP
content: Ahead of the by-election to the Ludhiana West Assembly constituency slated for June 19, the BJP hopes to garner the support of Sikhs, and make its presence felt in Punjab

title: Boundaries of most divisions in Kochi Corpn. undergo sea change in delimitation
content: While only two divisions have been added, multiple new ones were created and some eliminated, with populations now ranging between 6,500 and 9,000; exercise was based on the 2011 census

title: How Indy is exploiting New York's defense, plus more intel from the East finals
content: What are scouts, execs and coaches saying about the Pacers, Knicks and the test facing either team in the Finals?

title: Sources: Fins, Steelers talking trade for TE Smith
content: The Dolphins have engaged in trade discussions with the Steelers involving tight end Jonnu Smith, sources told ESPN.

title: CFP 5+11 model gaining traction among leaders
content: A 16-team College Football Playoff model featuring the top five conference champions and 11 at-large teams is gaining traction following SEC spring meetings this week.

title: Email error causes Caps to address Ovi's future
content: The Capitals say no decision has been made on Alex Ovechkin's future in the NHL after an email was sent to season-ticket holders calling next season his last.

title: Dodgers acquire ex-closer Diaz in trade with Reds
content: The Dodgers have acquired former All-Star closer Alexis Diaz from the Reds in exchange for minor leaguer Mike Villani. Diaz had 75 saves over the previous three seasons.

title: Boomer: WCWS walk-off by OU's Parker sinks Vols
content: Ella Parker hit a three-run, walk-off homer with two outs to lift Oklahoma to a 4-3 victory against Tennessee in the Women's College World Series.

title: Toews, ex-Blackhawks star, planning NHL return
content: Jonathan Toews, who stepped away from hockey two seasons ago after 15 seasons with the Blackhawks, is planning an NHL comeback, according to his agent.

title: Manfred: Reinstating Rose, Jackson was 'overdue'
content: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred said his decision to reinstate Pete Rose, "Shoeless" Joe Jackson and other deceased banned players was a matter of "baseball living up to the deal that they originally made" with Rose.

title: Dykes quips on UNC opener: 'Bad scheduling'
content: TCU will open the 2025 season against Bill Belichick and North Carolina two years after opening against Deion Sanders' first game at Colorado.

title: üìà MLB Power Rankings: Another change at No. 1
content: Through the first two months of the 2025 season, five different teams have sat atop our list. Who won the battle in Week 9?

title: Why two top MLB prospects are still in the minors despite huge numbers
content: Roman Anthony and Jac Caglianone are tearing up the minors while the Red Sox and Royals are scuffling. What gives?

title: Which WNBA offseason moves are making the biggest impact -- and who still has work to do?
content: Kelsey Plum, Natasha Cloud and a Phoenix duo have made an immediate impact on their new WNBA teams in 2025.

title: 16 NFC teams, 16 offseason awards: The good -- and most confusing -- additions
content: Green Bay has a wide receiver logjam. Washington loaded up on veterans. And San Francisco isn't quite ready to rebuild.

title: Bengals' Trey Hendrickson is 'extremely dug in' over contract dispute; here's what to know
content: Hendrickson said he won't play without a new contract, and mandatory minicamp is nearing. Will something give?

title: No Morgan, no Rapinoe: The USWNT doesn't have a face of the team now. Is that OK?
content: Since Alex Morgan retired, the USWNT has lacked a star leader. Is Trinity Rodman due for that role? Naomi Girma or someone else?

title: Sources: Chelsea to beat Man Utd to Delap signing
content: Chelsea have beaten Manchester United to the ¬£30 million signing of Liam Delap with sources telling ESPN, with a deal close to being finalised.

title: Milan fire Concei√ß√£o, reportedly line up Allegri
content: AC Milan fired Sergio Conceicao as expected on Thursday following a disappointing season that saw the Rossoneri fail to qualify for Europe.

title: Sources: Spirit coach Gir√°ldez close to Lyonnes job
content: Washington Spirit head coach Jonatan Gir√°ldez is in advanced discussions to take over as head coach of French powerhouse OL Lyonnes, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Man charged after Liverpool parade incident
content: A man has been charged after a car drove into a crowd of pedestrians following Liverpool's Premier League victory parade on Monday.

title: Mistrial declared in case over Maradona's death
content: An Argentine court has declared a mistrial in the case of seven health professionals accused of negligence in the death of soccer legend Diego Maradona.

title: Man Utd's Amad: No regrets over obscene gesture
content: Manchester United winger Amad Diallo has said he held up his middle finger to the crowd outside the team's hotel in Kuala Lumpur after insults were allegedly made about his mother.

title: Louisville's Fischer gets 3-match ban for hair pull
content: Racing Louisville FC forward Kayla Fischer will serve a three-game suspension for a hair-pulling incident, sources told ESPN.

title: We want Ronaldo to sign new deal - Al Nassr chief
content: Al Nassr want to extend Cristiano Ronaldo's contract but face competition for the his signature, Fernando Hierro said on Thursday.

title: Delayed flights, missed meals and little sleep: How college teams adjusted to cross-country travel
content: How Oregon State baseball and multiple teams at UCLA adapted to new schedules, for better and for worse.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: 2025 MLB mock draft 1.0: High school slugger or college ace at No. 1?
content: Starting with a wide-open top of the board, here's how the first round of this July's draft could play out.

title: How PSG moved on from Mbapp√©, Messi and Neymar -- but got better
content: Paris Saint-Germain once had all the game's biggest stars, but always fell short of Champions League glory. In 2025, with a team of young talent and no major egos, they're poised to finally break through.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool join race for ‚Ç¨100 million Ekitike
content: The race to acquire Hugo Ekitike has begun, with Liverpool and Chelsea set to fight for his signature.

title: Norris' win in Monaco has reset F1, McLaren title fight
content: Preseason title favorite Lando Norris was losing steam to teammate Oscar Piastri. That's no longer the case.

title: Ohtani scores 170 runs? Royals have a top-10 starting pitcher? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Rankings: Napheesa Collier jumps Caitlin Clark
content: Fantasy women's basketball rankings for 2025 with A'ja Wilson, Napheesa Collier and Caitlin Clark as the top three.

title: Expert picks and best bets: Can Barber extend her win streak vs. Blanchfield?
content: Retired MMA fighters Din Thomas and Anthony Smith make their predictions for the main event of the upcoming UFC Fight Night.

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: The latest entry in the revived series will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches.

title: 'I wanted to curse Trump': Why US is 'aggressively' revoking visas of Chinese students
content: The Trump administration's plan to revoke visas for Chinese students, particularly those with ties to the Chinese Communist Party or studying in critical fields, has sparked widespread concern. This move, coupled with new export controls on semiconductor software, threatens to disrupt the fragile trade truce between the US and China.

title: US appeals court allows Trump tariffs to 'temporarily' stay in effect
content: Donald Trump received temporary approval to continue collecting tariffs under emergency powers, following a federal trade court ruling that deemed his sweeping levies on foreign imports unlawful. The US Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit has paused the trade court's decision while the White House appeals.

title: 'Before we could ... ': Pak PM admits India's BrahMos volley foiled offensive plans
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif admitted that Indian missiles, including BrahMos, struck multiple locations inside Pakistan, including Rawalpindi airport. Sharif recounted Pakistan's planned retaliation, which was preempted by further Indian strikes following Operation Sindoor. India has rejected dialogue overtures, insisting that talks can only occur when Pakistan ceases cross-border terrorism and vacates PoK.

title: 7 BSF women defended 2 posts for 3 days & nights during Sindoor
content: In a historic moment, young BSF women personnel, led by Assistant Commandant Neha Bhandari, fiercely defended forward posts in J&K's Akhnoor sector during Operation Sindoor. They engaged Pakistani forces with heavy retaliatory fire for three days, compelling them to retreat. This marked a significant instance of women in active combat roles, showcasing their capabilities on par with their male counterparts.

title: RBI looks to shield forex kitty as geopolitical tensions rise
content: The RBI is fortifying its forex reserves against weaponization by diversifying assets across currencies and jurisdictions, reducing reliance on the US dollar. With reserves constituting 74% of its Rs 76 lakh crore balance sheet, the central bank aims to insulate the Indian economy from external shocks. Simultaneously, the RBI promotes rupee-denominated trade and enhances data security with the upcoming IFS Cloud.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: Mass resignations in Cong minority unit in Mangaluru over 'revenge killings'
content: In Dakshina Kannada, several Muslim Congress functionaries resigned, citing government negligence and failure to protect the community following revenge killings, including the murder of a mosque secretary.

title: With guv returning it for 2nd time, Karnataka mulls sending Muslim quota bill to President
content: Karnataka's Congress government is contemplating sending the Karnataka Transparency in Public Procurement (Amendment) Bill, 2025, to the President after the governor rejected it twice. The bill proposes 4% reservation for Muslims in civil contracts up to Rs 1 crore, alongside quotas for other categories. The government is exploring options after constitutional experts advised against challenging the governor's decision in court.

title: Remanded till June 2, Nagpur woman vows Pak return after release
content: Sunita Jamgade, a former nurse, was arrested in Nagpur for suspected espionage after crossing the LoC and entering POK. She disappeared on May 14, leaving her son in Kargil, and was handed over to Indian authorities by Pakistan Rangers after nine days.

title: Musk‚Äôs ‚ÄòApple ultimatum‚Äô that may have put Tim Cook in disagreement with his team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: 'Tied to suicide case', Maharashtra special IG relieved of additional charge
content: Following allegations of shielding accused individuals in the Vaishnavi Hagawane suicide case, the Maharashtra home department has relieved IPS officer Jalindar Supekar of his additional charge as DIG of prisons for Nashik, Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar, and Nagpur divisions. The decision was made considering the importance and responsibilities associated with the DIG post.

title: Submit inquiry file on security of Michel, Delhi court tells Tihar jail
content: A Delhi court has directed Tihar jail authorities to present the inquiry file concerning the security of Christian Michel James, who is jailed in connection with the AgustaWestland case. Special Judge Sanjeev Aggarwal has set June 6 as the deadline for the submission.

title: Brushing aside govt objection, SC gives relief to ex-IPS man
content: The Supreme Court has instructed the Central government to provide travel documents to T Prabhakar Rao, the former head of Telangana's Special Intelligence Bureau, currently in the US and declared a proclaimed offender. This will enable his return to India for investigation in a phone tapping case.

title: How one of Europe's biggest tech company lost $130 billion-plus from its value
content: ASML, a crucial semiconductor supplier, has witnessed a significant market value decline due to U.S. export restrictions to China and potential U.S. tariffs. The Dutch company's inability to ship advanced EUV machines to China impacts sales. Despite challenges, a potential U.S.-Europe trade deal could alleviate market concerns.

title: I‚Äôve become more famous: Pahalgam attack plotter in Pakistan
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba commander Saifullah Kasuri, a key plotter in the Pahalgam terror attack, delivered an inflammatory anti-India speech in Lahore, surrounded by Pakistani security forces and ISI officials. He boasted about his notoriety following the attack, sharing the stage with US-designated terrorist Talha Saeed. "I have become more famous since being accused of the attack," he gloated, as per information reaching here.

title: 'Dirty Harry' gets 10 yrs in US jail for 4 deaths during trafficking bid
content: Harshkumar Ramanlal Patel, known as "Dirty Harry," received a 10-year sentence in a US federal prison for his involvement in a human smuggling operation. This operation tragically led to the deaths of four members of a Gujarati family attempting to cross into the US from Canada in January 2022.

title: HC directs YouTuber to take down defamatory content on news agency
content: The Delhi High Court has directed YouTuber Mohak Mangal to remove parts of his video criticizing ANI's copyright practices. Justice Amit Bansal emphasized the need for civil discourse, objecting to Mangal's use of terms like 'hafta wasooli' and 'gunda raj.

title: Give local address or stay in Tihar: SC to Agusta accused
content: The Supreme Court denied Christian Michel James' plea to remove the bail condition requiring a local address, stating he could remain in Tihar Jail if unable to provide one. Michel, accused in the AgustaWestland scam, argued he lacked local contacts after six years in custody and a divorce.

title: Tight cover for Amarnath Yatra, Centre OKs 581 CAPF companies
content: The central government has sanctioned the deployment of 581 CAPF companies, approximately 58,000 personnel, to safeguard the Amarnath Yatra, commencing on July 3. This pilgrimage marks the first significant crowd-gathering event in Jammu & Kashmir since the Pahalgam attack. Besides the 156 companies already stationed, an additional 425 companies are being dispatched to the Union Territory to ensure security.

title: Three days after collegium picked them, 3 apex court judges appointed
content: President Murmu has appointed Justices N V Anjaria, Vijay Bishnoi, and Atil S Chandurkar to the Supreme Court, filling existing vacancies and bringing the court to its full strength of 34 judges. The appointments, swiftly approved by the government following the collegium's recommendation, mark one of the fastest appointments of SC judges.

title: You became a beast, not entitled to bail: SC to doc who molested daughter
content: The Supreme Court denied a doctor's request to suspend his life sentence under the POCSO Act for raping his seven-year-old daughter. Justices emphasized the severity of his actions, dismissing claims of being framed and highlighting the child's credible testimony. Despite concerns about appeal delays in Allahabad HC, the court refused bail, suggesting a future petition might be considered.

title: RCB's pack of wolves leave PBKS battered in their own backyard
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's dominant bowling attack dismantled Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, restricting them to a mere 101 runs. RCB's bowlers, including Hazlewood and Sharma, wreaked havoc, while Punjab's batting crumbled with soft dismissals and rash shots. Salt's explosive innings propelled RCB to a comfortable victory, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final.

title: 'Radicalised' jobless engineer kills parents, stabs 4 others in Bengal
content: Humayun Kabir, a jobless engineer radicalized by jihadi literature, murdered his parents in Memari due to ideological differences. He then traveled to Bongaon, where he attacked teachers and staff at an orphanage-madrasa after they refused to engage with his questions about Islam and jihad. Following his arrest, a mob attacked the police station, leading to further arrests for rioting.

title: Trump's trade policy in turmoil: Will India, China be tempted to hold off tariff talks?
content: A US trade court has rebuked Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs strategy, deeming his broad tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act as an overreach of presidential power. This ruling casts uncertainty on trade negotiations with key partners like China and India, potentially altering their negotiation strategies.

title: Pune doctor in Porsche row arrested in 2022 kidney racket case
content: Pune police arrested Dr. Ajay Taware, previously suspended from Sassoon General Hospital, in connection with a 2022 kidney transplant case at Ruby Hall Clinic. Accused of misusing his position on the Regional Authorisation Committee to facilitate a kidney swap based on fraudulent documents, Taware was remanded in police custody until June 2.

title: ‚ÄòBlatantly wrong‚Äô: Trump admin blasts US court ruling blocking tariffs
content: The Donald Trump administration has strongly opposed a US trade court decision. The court blocked President Trump's reciprocal tariffs. The White House stated that US trade policy will continue. The government is exploring other options. Trump's trade advisor, Peter Navarro, said the administration was not surprised. Officials are confident about appealing the decision. They believe alternative legal options are available.

title: 4 women deliver under phone torchlight in UP; probe ordered
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district, four women reportedly gave birth under mobile phone torchlight at a primary health centre due to a power outage, allegedly caused by a faulty transformer. This incident follows a recent video showing a woman delivering a baby on the floor of a community health centre in the same district. Dr.

title: Transfers spur 1 more Sidda-DKS turf war
content: A fresh dispute has erupted between Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar over the transfer of five senior engineers. Shivakumar has formally objected to the transfers, stating they were made without his approval, violating an agreement made when the government was formed.

title: ED: DHFL's Wadhawan tried to sell Rs 31cr paintings while in custody
content: While in judicial custody at a hospital, Dheeraj Wadhawan, ex-DHFL promoter, allegedly conspired to sell two high-end paintings worth Rs 31 crore, acquired using funds diverted from DHFL. The ED's chargesheet reveals a Rs 34,000 crore money laundering scheme involving fund diversion, fake loans, and asset acquisitions.

title: Why did Punjab Kings batters fail against Suyash Sharma?
content: Suyash Sharma's game-changing googly and Royal Challengers Bengaluru's dominant performance led to an eight-wicket victory over Punjab Kings in Qualifier 1, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final. Sharma's 3-17 spell dismantled PBKS, who were bundled out for 101, while Phil Salt's explosive fifty guided RCB to a comfortable chase in just 10 overs.

title: Judge blocks Trump move to ban Harvard from admitting foreign students
content: A US judge has blocked the Trump administration's move to prevent international students from enrolling at Harvard. This is another legal setback for the administration. The court wants to maintain the current situation while considering a final ruling. Harvard says many foreign students, including 800 from India, are uncertain about their future. Some are transferring, and others are delaying enrollment.

title: China ducks questions on weapons used by Pak against India
content: China declined to comment on the effectiveness of its weapons used by Pakistan during recent clashes with India, including the PL-15E missile. A Chinese spokesperson urged restraint between the two nations, reiterating China's commitment to regional peace. This follows India's strikes on terror infrastructure in Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack. China remains Pakistan's primary arms supplier, providing advanced military equipment.

title: Israel agrees to US proposal for temporary ceasefire, Hamas considering: WH
content: A US-backed proposal for a temporary ceasefire between Israel and Hamas has been agreed upon by Israel, potentially halting the Gaza war and securing hostage releases. The plan involves a troop pullback, hostage exchange for prisoners, and a 60-day halt in fighting, with assurances Israel won't resume military operations after the hostages are freed.

title: Gold price rise impact: Value of RBI‚Äôs gold surges 57% to Rs 4.32 lakh crore
content: The Reserve Bank of India's gold assets surged by 57.12% to Rs 4,31,624.8 crore by March 2025, driven by a 54.13 metric tonne increase in gold holdings and price appreciation. Total gold reserves reached 879.58 metric tonnes, with allocations to both the Issue and Banking Departments. India's gold reserves now constitute 11.

title: 'One more game and ... ': RCB captain sends clear message
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru dominated Punjab Kings, securing an eight-wicket victory in Qualifier 1 and advancing to their first IPL final since 2016. Punjab's aggressive batting faltered, leading to a mere 101 runs. RCB chased the target in 10 overs, propelled by Phil Salt's explosive half-century.

title: 'Tharoor very much part of family': Cong softens stance, but flags 'factual error'
content: The Congress party has softened its stance on Shashi Tharoor after his remarks on surgical strikes sparked internal criticism. Randeep Surjewala affirmed Tharoor's importance within the party, but clarified that his statement about the 2016 strike was factually incorrect. Surjewala's statement comes as Tharoor faces criticism from party colleagues over his recent remarks on surgical strikes.

title: Trump's tariff war: How China is preparing for a long-haul battle
content: Despite a US court challenge to Trump's tariff policies, China is preparing for a prolonged economic confrontation, focusing on microchips and strategic planning. Chinese officials anticipate sustained pressure from Washington, even with potential shifts in negotiation tactics and personnel.

title: From smile to shock: Preity Zinta's reaction goes viral as Punjab Kings collapse
content: Preity Zinta's initial cheer turned to concern as Punjab Kings endured a disastrous start against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in their IPL 2025 Qualifier 1 match. PBKS lost four crucial wickets within the Powerplay, including key players like Priyansh Arya and Prabhsimran Singh. Zinta's changing expressions mirrored the team's struggles as they reeled under pressure after the early collapse.

title: Anushka Sharma bursts into laughter as Punjab Kings collapse - WATCH
content: Punjab Kings' aggressive batting strategy backfired spectacularly in Qualifier 1 of IPL 2025, as they were bowled out for a mere 101 by Royal Challengers Bengaluru. RCB's pace attack, led by Hazlewood, and Suyash Sharma's spin dismantled Punjab's batting lineup. While Punjab‚Äôs batting failed miserably, they might find some hope in their league-stage win over KKR at the same venue, where they defended 111 on a similarly challenging pitch.

title: NFL top 10 most complete teams in 2025 and who‚Äôs built to win it all?
content: The 2025 NFL season is approaching, with the Eagles leading the pack due to Jalen Hurts and a strong roster. The Ravens, Chiefs, and Bills also boast impressive teams. The Broncos, with a potentially elite defense and developing quarterback, round out the top contenders, showcasing the importance of well-rounded teams.

title: Can magnesium deficiency lead to infertility - here's what we know
content: We all feel tired once in a while. While regular tiredness is okay, feeling unusually tired or weak, can be a sign of magnesium deficiency. Magnesium plays a key role in energy production. When levels are low, your body may struggle to produce enough energy, leading to constant fatigue even after rest.

title: Abraham Lucas‚Äô transformation sparks hope and debate among Seahawks fans
content: Seattle Seahawks' right tackle Abraham Lucas sparks debate with his dramatic physical transformation this offseason. After knee injuries hampered his 2023 season, Lucas's leaner, more muscular physique has fans both excited and concerned about his ability to hold up against powerful defensive linemen. His dedication to improving his body and technique signals a strong commitment to his comeback.

title: Climate Activist Greta Thunberg To Visit Gaza With Activists
content: Climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and other activists will set sail Sunday for Gaza on a humanitarian ship aimed at protesting Israel's war on the territory, a French-Palestinian lawmaker said.

title: Rajasthan Man Who Spent 90 Days In Pak And Sent SIM Cards Arrested: Cops
content: The Delhi Police has arrested a man from Rajasthan for allegedly aiding Pakistani Intelligence Operatives (PIOs) by supplying Indian mobile SIM cards for espionage activities, officials said on Thursday.

title: US Federal Court Reinstates Trump's Tariffs
content: A federal appeals court on Thursday reinstated the most sweeping of President Donald Trump's tariffs, a day after a trade court had ruled Trump had exceeded his authority in imposing the duties and had ordered an immediate block on them.

title: "If They Had Told Us Some Years Ago...": Ex Air Chief On Defence Delivery Delay
content: The crucial issue of delay in delivery of homegrown defence equipment and delayed timelines, that was flagged unexpectedly on Thursday by the Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh, was seconded today by his predecessor.

title: Commissioner, Senior Dakshina Kannada Cop Transferred After Mangaluru Murder
content: In the wake of communal tensions in Dakshina Kannada district following the recent murder of a youth, the Karnataka government on Thursday transferred Mangaluru City Police Commissioner Anupam Agrawal and appointed Sudheer Kumar Reddy in his place.

title: Ex-Goldman Sachs Banker Jailed For 2 Years For Bribery Scheme
content: A US judge on Thursday sentenced a former Goldman Sachs banker central to the 1MDB scandal to two years in prison after prosecutors argued for leniency due to his cooperation.

title: Chinese Military Evades Questions On Performance Of Weapons Used By Pak
content: The Chinese military on Thursday declined comment on the performance of China-made weapons used by Pakistan in the recent conflict with India.

title: BJP Slams Congress Leader's Controversial Comment Over MPs' Delegations
content: The BJP on Thursday accused the Congress of equating the parliamentarians, who are out on a foreign mission to expose Pakistan, with terrorists and demanded "strict action" on this issue.

title: 'Operation West Bengal': BJP Minister Sparks Row With New Campaign Call
content: BJP state president and Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar has stirred controversy on Thursday by invoking a new political campaign dubbed 'Operation West Bengal', aimed at ousting the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) from power.

title: Saudi Arabia Set For Searing Hajj With More Shade, Misting Machines And AI
content: With artificial intelligence, more shade and misting machines, Saudi authorities are preparing to welcome more than a million hajj pilgrims amid punishing summer heat that has a deadly history in the holy city of Mecca.

title: "Talks On J&K Will Be Held Only On Vacating Of PoK": Centre On Pakistan
content: External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal on Thursday said the only area left for discussion between the two countries is Pakistan's handing over of terrorists and vacating the illegally occupied area of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: High Court Junks Rahul Gandhi's Plea Against Summons In Army Remark Case
content: The Allahabad High Court on Thursday dismissed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's petition challenging a trial court's summons and complaint against him over alleged derogatory remarks about the Indian Army during his Bharat Jodo Yatra.

title: Israel Signed Off On Latest Gaza Ceasefire Proposal, Says White House
content: Israel has signed off on the latest US ceasefire proposal for Gaza before it was sent to the Palestinian Hamas group, White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt said on Thursday.

title: Pune Student, Arrested Over Op Sindoor Post, Appears For Exam After Bail
content: The Pune teen student, arrested for her social media post criticizing the Indian government over Operation Sindoor and later released on bail, has appeared for her semester examination under requisite security.

title: Woman Insists Daughter Studies Further, Gets Beaten Up By Husband: Cops
content: A woman in Mathura has filed a domestic violence case against her husband and in-laws for allegedly beating her because she insisted on allowing her daughter to continue studying after Class 10, police said on Tuesday.

title: France To Ban Smoking In Public Places, Including Parks And Beaches
content: France will ban smoking in all outdoor places that can be accessed by children, including beaches, parks and bus stops, the health and family minister announced Thursday.

title: SEBI Tightens Risk Monitoring In Equity Derivatives With New Measures
content: Markets regulator Sebi on Thursday came out with a series of measures to strengthen risk monitoring in equity derivatives, including the intra-day monitoring of market-wide position on single stock derivatives.

title: "Sometimes Unachievable, But We Sign Contract Anyway": Air Chief's Bombshell
content: India's Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh has raised concerns over delays in major defence procurement projects.

title: 1,080 Indians Deported From US Since January 2025: Foreign Ministry
content: Since January 2025, approximately 1080 Indians have been deported from the United States, with about 62 per cent of them returning through commercial flights.

title: "No Action For Now": On Shashi Tharoor Issue, Congress Stands Down
content: The Congress has decided they may not take any action against Shashi Tharoor for now over his comments on Operation Sindoor.

title: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase making history in the WNBA
content: the WNBA's first expansion team in 17 years, the Golden State Valkyries made their own mark in the history books . at just over 5-foot-1, she is not the prototypical basketball player or coach . she began her career as a walk-on guard at UCLA, eventually earning the starting job her junior year and becoming team captain .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .

title: Player survey: Who's the most underrated prospect in this class?
content: college basketball insider Jeff Borzello joined draft analysts Jeremy Woo and Jonathan Givony at the draft combine in Chicago earlier this month . a small handful received multiple votes, some were named by college teammates, some made the case for themselves and others insisted players featured in ESPN's latest mock draft were still underrated .

title: NHL free agency big board: Where does Marner land? Who are the other top options?
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season . it could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: MAC preview: Ohio will need to fend off Toledo, Buffalo as it looks for repeat
content: a big tent can produce occasionally incredible things . the idea of a so-called "super league" continues to waft around . in the past 25 seasons, MAC teams have scored 78 wins over power-conference teams .

title: Road to the MCWS: NCAA baseball tournament schedule, results
content: the 2025 NCAA Division I baseball championship begins on friday . Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .

title: Stars-Oilers Game 5 preview: Can Dallas extend the series?
